intro: Arachnorchis pholcoidea subsp. augustensis, commonly known as the August orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, spider-like appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellow, with intricate patterns that mimic the appearance of spiders. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and specialized ecological requirements.
